sections.title: Impairment of Assets
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IAS 36.

items.question: Does the entity disclose the amount of impairment losses recognised in profit or loss during the period and the line item(s) of the statement of comprehensive income in which those impairment losses are included?
Does the entity disclose the amount of reversals of impairment losses recognised in profit or loss during the period and the line item(s) in which those reversals are included?
Does the entity disclose the amount of impairment losses on revalued assets recognised in other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose the amount of reversals of impairment losses on revalued assets recognised in other comprehensive income during the reporting period?

If the entity reports segment information under IFRS 8 Operating Segments, does it disclose the amount of impairment losses recognised in profit or loss and in other comprehensive income during the reporting period for each reportable segment?

If the entity reports segment information, does it disclose the amount of reversals of impairment losses recognised in profit or loss and in other comprehensive income during the reporting period for each reportable segment?

If an impairment loss or reversal for an individual asset or cash-generating unit is recognised or reversed during the period, does the entity disclose the events and circumstances that led to that recognition or reversal?
Does the entity disclose the amount of the impairment loss recognised or reversed?
For an individual asset, does the entity disclose the nature of the asset?
If the entity reports segment information, does it disclose the reportable segment to which the impaired or reversed asset belongs?
For a cash-generating unit, does the entity provide a description of that unit (such as product line, plant, business operation, geographical area or reportable segment)?
Does the entity disclose the amount of the impairment loss recognised or reversed by class of assets and, if applicable, by reportable segment?

If the way assets are aggregated for identifying the cash-generating unit has changed since the previous estimate, does the entity describe the current and former aggregation and explain the reasons for the change?
Does the entity disclose the recoverable amount of the asset or cash-generating unit and whether it is fair value less costs of disposal or value in use?
If the recoverable amount is fair value less costs of disposal, does the entity disclose the level of the fair value hierarchy within which that measurement is categorised?
For fair value measurements categorised within Level 2 or 3, does the entity describe the valuation technique(s) used and any changes in technique with reasons?
For fair value measurements within Level 2 or 3, does the entity disclose each key assumption and the discount rate(s) used?
If the recoverable amount is value in use, does the entity disclose the discount rate(s) used in the current and previous estimates?

For the aggregate impairment losses and reversals for which no individual disclosures under IAS 36.130 are provided, does the entity disclose the main classes of assets affected by impairment losses and the main classes affected by reversals?
Does the entity disclose the main events and circumstances that led to recognition of those impairment losses and reversals?
For each cash-generating unit with significant goodwill or indefinite-life intangibles, does the entity disclose the carrying amount of goodwill allocated to that unit?
Does the entity disclose the carrying amount of intangible assets with indefinite useful lives allocated to that unit?
Does the entity disclose the basis on which the unit’s recoverable amount has been determined (value in use or fair value less costs of disposal)?
If the recoverable amount is value in use, does the entity disclose each key assumption used in cash flow projections?
Does the entity describe management’s approach to determining the values assigned to each key assumption, including consistency with past experience or external sources?
Does the entity disclose the discount rate(s) applied to the cash flow projections?
If the recoverable amount is fair value less costs of disposal, does the entity disclose the valuation technique(s) used?
If fair value less costs of disposal is not based on a quoted price, does the entity disclose each key assumption to which the recoverable amount is most sensitive?
Does the entity describe management’s approach to determining the values assigned to those key assumptions?
Does the entity disclose the fair value hierarchy level within which the fair value measurement is categorised?
If there has been a change in valuation technique, does the entity disclose the change and the reasons for it?
If fair value less costs of disposal is measured using discounted cash flow projections, does the entity disclose the period over which cash flows are projected?
Does the entity disclose the value assigned to the key assumption in those projections?
Does the entity disclose the amount by which the key assumption must change, after considering any consequential effects, for the recoverable amount to equal the carrying amount?
If goodwill or indefinite-life intangibles are allocated across multiple units and allocations to each are not individually significant, does the entity disclose that fact?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate carrying amount of goodwill or indefinite-life intangibles allocated to those units?
If recoverable amounts of multiple units are based on the same key assumptions and their aggregate carrying amount is significant, does the entity disclose that fact?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate carrying amount of goodwill allocated to those units?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate carrying amount of intangible assets with indefinite useful lives allocated to those units?
Does the entity describe the key assumption(s) common to those units?

Does the entity describe management’s approach to determining the values assigned to the key assumption(s), including consistency with past experience or external sources and any consequential effects for the recoverable amounts to equal carrying amounts?
